notes:
Total tests are taken from the annotations on the charts on the page. 
Negatives = (Totals – Positives)
Positives occasionally update before totals do; do not revise negatives down, keep the last calculated negative.
Last Updated (Local Time) = (current date + time = 15:00)
name: Alaska

notes:
Negatives = (Totals - Positives) 
Positives occasionally update before totals do; do not revise negatives down, keep the last calculated negative.
Last Updated (Local Time) = (current date + time = 00:00)
name: Alabama

notes: Data is displayed across two web pages. timestamp provided by primary page, not dashboard. [Dashboard](https://adem.maps.arcgis.com/apps/opsdashboard/index.html#/f533ac8a8b6040e5896b05b47b17a647)
name: Arkansas

notes: American Samoa: No data, no confirmed cases yet.
name: American Samoa

notes: Negative = “Ruled Out”. Negatives inferred from [a 3/26 media report](https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/us/stop-most-coronavirus-testing-arizonas-top-health-official-tells-doctors/ar-BB11LI31). Arizona has 2 numbers for AHPL positives which often conflict by a small amount. We now use the number in the "Laboratory Type" table after confirming that this number correctly de-duplicates people who were tested in both public and commercial labs.
name: Arizona

notes: California continues to show a huge number of pending tests. We add the death count back into the positive results number, because California has been excluding them from their positive count. The state has been inconsistent in its timing of reporting, so we are now using the [Sonoma County dashboard](https://sonomacounty.maps.arcgis.com/apps/MapSeries/index.html?appid=21a1653b79ba42039ff22bcb85fa5b19) for case counts and deaths, and state numbers for negatives and other outcome data. We assume that "tests conducted" = "people tested."
name: California

notes: Negative = Total - Cases. Cases include people who test positive for COVID-19 AND people who have symptoms of COVID-19 and are a close contact to someone who tested positive.
name: Colorado

notes: Data is being provided in a PDF. Negative = Total - Positive.  Hospitalization numbers are in a bar chart there.
name: Connecticut

notes: Positive and Negative include both public and commercial labs.
name: District Of Columbia

notes: Last reported negative number is from 3/13.
name: Delaware

notes: Although Florida on 3/26 dropped non-residents from its positives, we report all positives (residents + non-residents) that they record.  3/21 saw a jump in negatives due to change in methodology: they began including tests of people who had never been investigated as PUIs.
name: Florida

notes: Positive includes deaths. The page includes a "report generated" time at the bottom of the page and a data "as of" time. We use the "as of" time a the top of the page as our Update Time.
name: Georgia

notes: Counts do not include 4 US sailors who tested positive are in quarantine on a naval base. .
name: Guam

notes: Data now pulled from dashboard. Negatives no longer reported. The state [retracted](https://www.hawaiinewsnow.com/2020/03/24/state-officials-report-first-coronavirus-related-death-hawaii/) its first COVID-related death.
name: Hawaii

notes: If no timestamp was given, time = 00:00. Not all commercial labs report negatives to Iowa, as per their guidance.
name: Iowa

notes: Total includes Oregon residents tested in Idaho, as the state does in its table (noted below).  Negatives = Totals - Positives. Positives sometimes update before totals do; when this happens, we keep the last calculated negative.
name: Idaho

notes: Our data differs from Illinois because we count deaths as positives.
name: Illinois

notes: Negative = Total – Positive. Totals are incomplete for private labs, so negatives are a lower bound.
name: Indiana

notes: Latest numbers from [daily KS update](https://khap2.kdhe.state.ks.us/NewsRelease/COVID19/COVID-19_March_24_2020_.pdf).
name: Kansas

notes: Deaths from [news reports](https://www.wkyt.com/content/news/Sixth-COVID-19-death-in-Ky-reported-in-Hopkins-County-569162781.html). Negatives decreased for unknown reasons on 3/20.
name: Kentucky

notes: Negative = Total - Positive. Hospitalizations reported [separately](http://ldh.la.gov/index.cfm/newsroom/detail/5509).
name: Louisiana

notes: Positives include results from the CDC. Total tested includes repeat testing on individuals. State lab numbers are as of 8 am, other lab numbers are as of 11:30 am. Commercial lab numbers are subject to change.
name: Massachusetts

notes: Didn't report negatives between 3/12 and 3/28.
name: Maryland

notes: Use the time at the top row of the table.
name: Maine

notes: Michigan stopped reporting negatives on 3/20. We've rolled that number forward. On 3/26, they began reporting "total specimens" tested as 11886, but we are waiting from guidance from the state before adding the number to their total because specimens tested is not equal to people tested.
name: Michigan

notes: Since 3/23, Negative = Total - Positive. Hospitalization from Minnesota Department of Health press conference.
name: Minnesota

notes: Negative = Total - Positive
name: Missouri

notes: Mariana Islands.
name: Northern Mariana Islands

notes: Negative = total tests (state lab only) - total positives (state and commercial labs). This is a lower bound for actual negatives. Positives sometimes update before totals do; when this happens, we keep the last calculated negative. Update time is the "as of" time from the state chart. Hospitalizations calculated based on the % in the pie chart.
name: Mississippi

notes: Negative = Total - Positive.  Each data field has its own timestamp, we use the most recent.
name: Montana

notes: Negatives = Total tests* - total positives (where total tests include all data from public labs and partial data from hospital and commercial labs).
name: North Carolina

notes: Numbers reflect only those tested at the public health lab. North Dakota stopped reporting pending numbers.
name: North Dakota

notes: If no timestamp was given, time = 00:00. Latest positive count from [separate press release](http://dhhs.ne.gov/Pages/Additional-COVID-19-cases-reported-in-Lancaster,-Buffalo-and-Douglas-Counties.aspx).
name: Nebraska

notes: Negative count is from the four largest labs. Pending count is from the Public Health Laboratories only.
name: New Hampshire

notes: Positive count includes deaths. Negatives now include all laboratories. There's a [dashboard available](covid19.nj.gov) but the testing data there is not as comprehensive as [this table](www.nj.gov/health).
name: New Jersey

notes: Positives number from press release more recent than negatives number reported on website.
name: New Mexico

notes: Pending = Totals – Positives – Negatives. Individual data fields have different update times; we use the latest time as our "Last Update" time. NV is one of the rare states to distinguish # of people tested from # of samples tested.
name: Nevada

notes: Numbers come from [press conference](https://www.governor.ny.gov).
name: New York

notes: Ohio releases some numbers in [slide decks](https://www.dropbox.com/s/d8od1r2zr9wrsnv/Ohio%203-25%20Presser.pdf?dl=0).
name: Ohio

notes: Pending = "PUIs pending results." We exclude "Positive (Out-of-State)" results as we assume these individuals are isolated outside the state. Last Update time based on the "As of" time below the charts.
name: Oklahoma

notes: County level data doesn't add up to the totals provided. We don't add deaths back into positives until we have more clarity on whether they are already included in the positive count.
name: Pennsylvania

notes: Puerto Rico reports positive, negative, and pending.
name: Puerto Rico

notes: Latest positives, deaths, and hospitalized from 3/29 [press conference](https://www.facebook.com/GinaMRaimondo/videos/214205249800791/)
name: Rhode Island

notes: Negatives only from state public health labs. Hospitalization data carried over from weekly 3/25 presentation.
name: South Carolina

notes: Tennessee now provides positive and negative test results from all laboratories.
name: Tennessee

notes: We are assuming Texas is reporting only completed testing, pending further guidance, which we are seeking from the state.
name: Texas

notes: Positives include non-Utah residents. Negative = Total - Positive. Negative test results may lag for up to 72 hours, according to the state.
name: Utah

notes: VA also graphs the count of illnesses by the date that they began.
name: Virginia

notes: Virgin Islands: Positives, Negatives, and Pending provided.
name: US Virgin Islands

notes:
Negatives = (Total Tested - Positives)
Hospitalization number last tracked by Erin Petenko of [VTDigger](VTdigger.com) on 3/27.
name: Vermont

notes: Total tests are below the tables with positive cases. Positive includes deaths. As of 3/26, "A small percentage of lab reports (<1%) have yet to be reviewed and are currently counted as negatives*". Hospitalizations from 3/25 in [Seattle Times](https://www.seattletimes.com/seattle-news/health/more-than-250-people-in-washington-hospitalized-last-week-with-covid-19-like-symptoms-as-part-of-monthlong-upward-trend-state-data-shows/).
name: Washington

notes: Updates expected at 2 pm CT
name: Wisconsin

notes: Pending = "Under Investigation". Hospitalization reported [by media](https://wchstv.com/news/local/judicial-employee-hospitalized-with-covid-19).
name: West Virginia

notes: Wyoming's guidance is that commercial labs are only irregularly reporting negatives. Negatives = (Total - Positive) unless this results in a lower number of positives than previously reported
name: Wyoming
